channel.title: Ens on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Ens on A Hugo website

item.title: Exploratory Data Analyst (SQL)
item.description: Exploratory Data Analyst applies to the following cases: vague targets or problems to the large data set large data set needs cleaning Benefit of the exploratory data analyst: help find the inner pattern or relationship through the data help to categorize the variables for the further analysis. (missing, outlier etc.) Three type of data Numeric data We would like to know the min and max, average, variance and correlation and percentile to this type of data.

item.title: Meta Analysis
item.description: ref NOTE: most words are from the ref above, and it is a mini summary from my own perspective. Since I am truly not able to find the better word to describe. Meta Analysis is a method used the data results from individual studies. Studies are coming from computerized Literature Search of a database such as PudMed etc. The auto search are based on the participants, interventions, comparison and study designs indicated in the contrasts of the scientific papers.

item.title: Git help
item.description: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system. working directory. staging area(index). git repository. three different objects generate from git cmd and describe in Hash: blob: only save the content of the file instead the file name. tree: the file name. commit: the first commit also called root commit. git basic git init: generate a file called /.git/ used ls -a to see all the hided files.

item.title: cv+resume
item.description: Site: The Bishop Strachan School Position: Data Analyst Dear Manager I am writing to express my keen interest in Data Analyst position in the Bishop Strachan School. I graduated from the Bio-statistics master program in the year 2019 and started to work in TD bank as Data Support Analysis. My passion and motivation came from assisting shareholder make decision from data-driven outcomes and tutoring in subject: elementary programming, math, elementary statitiscs.

item.title: Experimental Design
item.description: Some concepts and examples in Experimental Design experimental study: a study subject is assigned the treatment observational study: a study with subject is observed or measured experimental unit: in an experimental study, basic entity can be assigned is called experimental unit. The experimental unit is people, called subject. At observational and experimental study, subjects are called participants. Experimental Design A good experimental design will need: 1. treatments are random assigned to the experimental unit.

item.title: Missing Data
item.description: Missing data What types of missing data? Missing completely at random Missing at random Missing not at random What technique to handle missing data? Listwise or case deletion： assumption：sample size are large con: simple implement pro: loss given information Pairwise deletion? assumption： not missing here and there, con：compare with the listwise, the lost information reduced pro：cause inaccurate stand error as the knowing Mean substitutionn? assumption: con： increase the sample size pro: underestimate the errors Regression imputation assumption: the value of other data are not missing con: increase the sample size, reduce the stand error pro: add extra effort into finding the fitted regression model Last observation carried forward assumption: the outcome remains unchanged by the missing data con: easy communicate , typically used method on longitudinal data pro: need meet the assumption Maximum likelihood assumption: known distribution, etc.

item.title: Blog Down
item.description: get start: hugo go: config Content Front matter Templates _default/list.html: terms.html Partials/ .stores the templates reused in other html pages by the {{ partial }} function. footer.html Custom layouts Static files Lastly Addin …. get start: here we go. already started hugo go: a tool we we can leverage to generate the static website. The layout below follows my master config config.*: in the format of . toml or yaml, the file speak globally.

item.title: SAS
item.description: SQL You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order, and each of their nodes contains a single digit. Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list. You may assume the two numbers do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself. source For this problem we will begin with the sashelp.baseball data set. Create a new table called newtable in the work library that has exactly the same rows as the sashelp.

item.title: SQL
item.description: DEFINATION OF RELATION TABLES HOW TO CHANGE THE ENTITY TO A SCHEMAS CASE WHEN SUBQUERY COMMON TABLE EXPRESS (cte) WINDOW FUN ROLLUP and CUBE TABLESAMPLE UNPIVOT:ROW TO COLUMN PIVOT:COLUME TO ROW Some information contains from Datacamp, you can use my refer to get started and learn new technique together. DEFINATION OF RELATION TABLES entity: (table) the object store the information attribute: column in a table to describe the part of the information

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.
